intro: Schinus polygama f. australis, commonly known as the Australian pepper tree, is a variant of the Schinus polygama species native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are alternate and consist of several elliptical leaflets. Its small, red, berry-like fruits are an important food source for various wildlife species. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been introduced to other parts of the world, including Australia.
